author: instructor_001
summary: How do I implement lazy loading in React?
details: I want to improve my page load times. Whatâ€™s the best way to implement lazy loading for components?

answer.author: instructor_001
answer.details: Use React.lazy() for dynamically importing components and wrap them with <Suspense fallback>. It improves performance for large components.

answer.author: student_collective
answer.details: We used lazy loading in our project by splitting big pages into smaller components using dynamic import(). Worked well for us!

follow_ups.author: user_002
follow_ups.details: Can you show your current component structure?

replies.author: user_001
replies.details: Yes, I started using Suspense recently.

author: user_005
summary: Which project topic should we choose?
details: Options: A) NLP chatbot B) Fraud detection ML C) Social network visualization

answer.author: instructor_004
answer.details: Pick the topic your team has the skills for. NLP chatbot is easier but fraud detection has deeper ML concepts.

answer.author: student_collective
answer.details: Most of us think NLP chatbot is manageable within the project timeline.

replies.author: user_010
replies.details: Fraud detection is more industry relevant.

replies.author: user_009
replies.details: True, but also harder to implement.

author: user_011
details: What is the practical difference between 3NF and BCNF?

answer.author: instructor_008
answer.details: BCNF is stricter than 3NF. Any dependency where the determinant is not a superkey violates BCNF.

answer.author: student_collective
answer.details: We think of BCNF as a stronger, cleaner version of 3NF that removes edge-case anomalies.

follow_ups.author: user_004
follow_ups.details: BCNF removes even more functional dependency anomalies.

author: user_006
summary: Summary of today's lecture on Graph Search
details: Covered BFS, DFS, UCS, A* algorithm and heuristics.

answer.author: instructor_006
answer.details: Great summary! Don't forget to explain admissible heuristics in A*.

answer.author: student_collective
answer.details: We found using Manhattan distance works well for grid-based search problems.

follow_ups.author: user_004
follow_ups.details: Can you add pseudocode for A*?

follow_ups.author: user_012
follow_ups.details: What heuristic did the professor recommend?

replies.author: user_004
replies.details: Use Euclidean distance when diagonal movement is allowed.

author: user_008
summary: Why is my Node.js server crashing?

answer.author: instructor_010
answer.details: Wrap async logic in try/catch or use .catch(), otherwise unhandled rejections crash the server.

answer.author: student_collective
answer.details: We also had this issue. Adding return statements inside async handlers fixed it.

follow_ups.author: user_010
follow_ups.details: You're probably not catching async errors using try/catch.

replies.author: user_008
replies.details: I'll add try/catch around async code.

replies.author: user_003
replies.details: Also make sure to return inside handlers.
